subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: Ebay auction for sorta Frank's Box?
author: April Abercrombie
full_text:
------=_NextPart_000_00EA_01C9D9F7.03015BE0
Content-Type: text/plain;
	charset="iso-8859-1"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

Yes, except for the blatant lie about Frank. Yes-that doesn't take away buy=
er responsibility, but were it me, I wouldn't want someone using my name in=
 a fraudulent fashion.

So I would politely ask him to take that part out, =
giving him the benefit of the doubt that he was misinformed.

  ----- Origi=
nal Message ----- 
  From: Kristin Morris 
  To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com 
 =
 Sent: Thursday, May 21, 2009 8:58 AM
  Subject: RE: [EVP-ITC] Re: Ebay auc=
tion for sorta Frank's Box?






  Really if you think about it the guy is=
n't doing anything wrong per se..  He makes claims and offers a disclaimer.=
  His biggest mistake is what feel is the ethical decision to sell a Radio =
Shack radio without disclosing that this could be done on their own.  But a=
dd in the software and the price then doesn't seem so unrealistic.  But tha=
t IJMHO.  Of course his misinformed info about Frank and his boxes is ridic=
ulous but he might actually believe this all to be true.   So in the end ag=
ain I say Caveat emptor..  




-------------------------------------------=
-----------------------------------

  From: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com [mailt=
o:EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com] On Behalf Of SnowfireL@...
  Sent: Thursday,=
 May 21, 2009 9:50 AM
  To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
  Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC=
] Re: Ebay auction for sorta Frank's Box?








  It's none of my busines=
s but, Frank will need to call ebay the number can be found in the security=
 section, and he will have to let them know they are committing fraud, othe=
rwise nothing will be done.  I saw these ads on ebay too, but I thought, Fr=
ank may have been trying to earn some money for all his hard work, nothing =
wrong with that either, that was before I joined these groups. sf









=


  In a message dated 5/21/2009 10:45:09 A.M. Eastern Daylight Time, april=
@... writes:



    Yeah-the seller, but you can't=
 contact the bidders.



      ----- Original Message ----- 

      From: t=
hreadsintyme@... 

      To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com 

      Sent: Thu=
rsday, May 21, 2009 8:41 AM

      Subject: RE: [EVP-ITC] Re: Ebay auction =
for sorta Frank's Box?



      They most certainly do, Kristin. There is a=
 place on the ad where you can contact the seller directly and raise the is=
sue with the seller.
      Al
      ---------- Original Message ----------
=
      From: "Kristin Morris" <ckmorris95@...>
      To: <EVP-ITC@=
yahoogroups.com>
      Subject: RE: [EVP-ITC] Re: Ebay auction for sorta Fr=
ank's Box?
      Date: Thu, 21 May 2009 09:17:07 -0500

      I don't think=
 EBAY allows people to contact the bidders anymore.. that's why their names=
 are partially hidden??  I know how you feel tho..


----------------------=
----------------------------------------------------

      From: EVP-ITC@y=
ahoogroups.com [mailto:EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com] On Behalf Of April Abercrom=
bie
      Sent: Thursday, May 21, 2009 9:09 AM
      To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroup=
s.com
      Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: Ebay auction for sorta Frank's Box?
=







      Yes...I know.... but it is fun to fantasize. Plus, if I am in =
a position to make a difference I will. The problem is knowing when or wher=
e that position is.

        ----- Original Message ----- 

        From: K=
ristin Morris 

        To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com 

        Sent: Thursda=
y, May 21, 2009 7:56 AM

        Subject: RE: [EVP-ITC] Re: Ebay auction fo=
r sorta Frank's Box?

        We can't police the entire internet.  People =
should take responsibility for themselves and do some research and find out=
 how this works before they purchase.  

        Caveat emptor..  


------=
------------------------------------------------------------------

       =
 From: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com [mailto:EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com] On Behalf O=
f April Abercrombie
        Sent: Thursday, May 21, 2009 8:45 AM
        To=
: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
        Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: Ebay auction f=
or sorta Frank's Box?








        Exactly! That's what I'm sayin'.

   =
     Wouldn't it be a hoot if Frank himself blasted the guy. But that isn't=
 the mature way..... ;)

          ----- Original Message ----- 

         =
 From: threadsintyme@... 

          To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com 

   =
       Sent: Thursday, May 21, 2009 5:52 AM

          Subject: RE: [EVP-IT=
C] Re: Ebay auction for sorta Frank's Box?

          Why don't some of us =
respond to his ad...and take serious issue with this business of his lying =
to the public about Frank? 

          That info is a serious breach of eBa=
y policy. He could be banned from eBay for life. 
          Al
          --=
-------- Original Message ----------
          From: "Kristin Morris" <ckmo=
rris95@...>
          To: <EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com>
          Sub=
ject: RE: [EVP-ITC] Re: Ebay auction for sorta Frank's Box?
          Date:=
 Thu, 21 May 2009 06:16:27 -0500

          WOW.. Frank.  I didn't realize =
you were charging - and "thousands of dollars" to boot!  Must be to pay for=
 that Faraday Cage and the white noise generator thing this yahoo believes =
are in all your creations.  And hurry because "his supplier" (cough - cough=
 Radio Shack) is discontinuing!  But no worries he has "sold over 2 dozen o=
f these 'Frank's Boxes devices" so he must be legit because he knows - and =
actual customer bought a 'real' Frank's Box and said it was equal!  Awesome=
.

          k


----------------------------------------------------------=
------------

          From: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com [mailto:EVP-ITC@yahoo=
groups.com] On Behalf Of ourobouros2k2
          Sent: Thursday, May 21, 20=
09 12:50 AM
          To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
          Subject: [EVP-I=
TC] Re: Ebay auction for sorta Frank's Box?









          Been followi=
ng this unprofessional idiot's items for awhile now. I love how he says tha=
t Frank charges thousands of dollars for an original Frank's box. 

       =
   This dude is the worst type of con, preying on people who know only enou=
gh to be familiar with the term Frank's box. Then again, it always has both=
ered me when people take shack hacks and charge stupid prices for them on e=
bay under the Frank's box moniker.

          This guy is based out of Neva=
da I believe, and his group's ethics leave little to be desired. Takes all =
kinds, I reckon...

          Andy

          --- In EVP-ITC@...=
m, Aquarius <laustin@...> wrote:
          >
          > Hmmm... saw this o=
n Ebay tonight... you've got to read all the text to hear
          > how h=
e describes what he's selling. 
          > 
          > Do any of you on t=
his list know who he is? I just thought this was kind of
          > intere=
sting... see:
          > 
          > http://tinyurl.com/o5pper
          =
> 
          > Cheers,
          > 
          > Leslie, consistent lurker a=
nd occasional poster <g>
          > 
          > "I'm not happy, I'm cheer=
ful. There's a difference. A happy woman has no
          > cares at all. A=
 cheerful woman has cares but has learned how to deal with them."
         =
 > 
          > -- Beverly Sills (1929-) American Opera Singer
